channel.title: For those of you who want magic and smithing cheaply
channel.description: Hi guys, I have been playing around with prices in runescape for a little and I found a good way to get smithing xp and magic xp pretty dang cheep. At max it would cost 26m to get 99 in both with this method but if you do it the long way it would probably make you money, and heres the kick, free players can do it too! Alot of you know the spell "Super heat" in RuneScape but never really think twice about it because you can smith in a furence without wasting a nature rune, am I right? Well I found out that if you buy all the supply's at market for mirthril ore you can make a mith bar only losing about 6 coins, I checked the ge and it has been like this for about 5 months so it probably wont change anytime soon. Also you make profit or at least break even doing steal bars, it gives about 38k xp in mage and hour and 23k xp in smithing an hour. Pretty damn good for two of the high priced skill I would say. Also helps you make your pkers without having an insane level of hp. Goodluck with the Nerding out guys :p

item.title: For those of you who want magic and smithing cheaply
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:44, topic:387744”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=483539.msg3544928#msg3544928 date=1301126266]

Interestingly Enough I don’t have support for fee’s in my recipe class guess I will have to add that.
[/quote]5X coins? (Coins,Coins,Coins,Coins,Coins) sounds like a fee to me

But you should just implement something like <materials=“Bucket2,Coins20,Plank*2” />
if you know what I mean

it has quantity ability the format is Bucket(2) the problem is the recipe class looks up the items in the grand exchange coins are not found in the GE so I will need to add a Fee object or rsitem object.[/quote]Parenthesis is a bad identifier for quantity, as it is used in some items already

Read full topic

Interestingly Enough I don’t have support for fee’s in my recipe class guess I will have to add that.
[/quote]5X coins? (Coins,Coins,Coins,Coins,Coins) sounds like a fee to me

But you should just implement something like <materials=“Bucket2,Coins20,Plank*2” />
if you know what I mean[/quote]
it has quantity ability the format is Bucket(2) the problem is the recipe class looks up the items in the grand exchange coins are not found in the GE so I will need to add a Fee object or rsitem object.

item.title: For those of you who want magic and smithing cheaply
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:26, topic:387744”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=483539.msg3543788#msg3543788 date=1301044229]

One thing that will change this in the future. The more people that do this, the less there are in the grand exchange, the higher the price. Simple economics. Supply goes down, demand goes up. However, it might not be a problem if there is a steady flow of coal/materialX flowing into the grand exchange, by players/bots. And technically, there is an infinite supply of all materials in an infinite amount of time. So I guess as long as the amount of items being bought/sold remains fairly even, this should work ^_^.

I think RuneScapes got quite enough mining bots to keep this in check have you seen the mining guild lately? lol
[/quote]

Honestly I haven’t played RuneScape for more than an hour in probably 2-3 years.[/quote]
Same, I just merch and then log out. I like playing but then I realize that im wasting my day playing a game for pixel items.

Read full topic
